Flow.description: Coordinates the activity and confirmation of upload of documents for the customer to see.

formulas.description: Retirement call date formatted as string for folder name.

Flow.label: Advice | Customer Document Upload

fields.name: Header15
fields.fieldText: Portal Documents Folder Creation | {!household.Name}

fields.name: AdHocUnderwayPrompt
fields.fieldText: Enablement of portal docs is already underway for this client. Please look at the activity list and talk with the task owner.

fields.name: Header14
fields.fieldText: Portal Documents Folder Creation | {!household.Name}

fields.name: AdHocTaskPrompt
fields.fieldText: Proceed to create an ad-hoc portal docs enablement task for the household.

fields.name: AdviceUploadPromptPostMigration
fields.fieldText:
Advice Folder Upload | {!household.Name}﻿

{!AdviceFolderInstructions}

fields.name: RetirementCallUploadPromptPostMigration
fields.fieldText:
Retirement Call Folder Upload | {!household.Name}

{!AdviceFolderInstructionsRetirementCall}

fields.name: DropboxContentsUploadedToGoogleDriveFolderMigration
fields.fieldText: New advice folder set up

fields.name: Header4
fields.fieldText: Portal Documents Setup | {!household.Name}

fields.name: ConfirmationMessage
fields.fieldText:
If you proceed:

  • You are confirming that you have transferred only files that the client is meant to see and that the Google Drive folder is correct
  • The client will be able access to all files that you have transferred from Dropbox
  • A task will generate for someone else in ops to 4 eye this work, after which you will be assigned a task to email the client about the new documents section of the portal and their new advice documents

fields.name: Signature
fields.fieldText: Enter your email to confirm you understand

validationRule.errorMessage: Enter your email address

fields.name: Header10
fields.fieldText: Portal Documents Setup | {!household.Name}

fields.name: ConfirmationMessage4Eye
fields.fieldText:
If you proceed:

  • You are confirming that only files that the client is meant to see have been migrated from Dropbox to their {!GOOGLE_FOLDER_NAME} folder
  • The client will be able access to all files that are in that folder

fields.name: ConfirmationMessage4EyeNotActive
fields.fieldText:
If you proceed:

  • You are confirming that only files that the client is meant to see have been migrated from Dropbox to their {!GOOGLE_FOLDER_NAME} folder
  • While this client is not active, there is a possibility they still have access to the portal or could join us again and get access to these documents

fields.name: Signature4Eye
fields.fieldText: Enter your email to confirm you understand

validationRule.errorMessage: Enter your email address

fields.name: Header5
fields.fieldText: Portal Documents Setup | {!household.Name}

fields.name: DeletionMessage
fields.fieldText: Delete the folder contents from your desktop. You must delete the .zip file as well as the folders you uploaded.

fields.name: DeletionConfirmation
fields.fieldText: Folder and files deleted from desktop

fields.name: Header16
fields.fieldText: Dropbox Upload | {!household.Name}

fields.name: DropboxPrompt
fields.fieldText: As this is a {!household.Type} household, please do the upload via Dropbox.

fields.name: DropboxConfirmation
fields.fieldText: I have uploaded to Dropbox and emailed/text the client

fields.name: DateTimeEmailedDropbox
fields.fieldText: When did you email the client?

validationRule.errorMessage: Cannot be in the future

fields.name: ErrorMessageDisplay
fields.fieldText:
Error occurred. Please raise a ticket if you cannot self resolve.


{!errorMessage}

fields.name: Header12
fields.fieldText: Portal Documents Folder Creation | {!household.Name}

fields.name: NewClientPortalFolder
fields.fieldText: Proceed to create the client's new {!GOOGLE_FOLDER_NAME} folder.

fields.name: Header13
fields.fieldText: Portal Documents Folder Creation | {!household.Name}

fields.name: NewClientPortalFolderError
fields.fieldText:
The {!GOOGLE_FOLDER_NAME} folder cannot be found.


Please check if it is in the household Google Drive folder. If you can see it, click refresh.


If not, please wait 2 minutes to see if it appears and refresh when it does.


If it doesn't appear after 2 minutes, please raise a ticket with the product team.

fields.name: Header1
fields.fieldText: Household folder check | {!household.Name}

fields.name: GoogleFolderLinkTest
fields.fieldText: Open the household Google Drive folder and inspect the contents (e.g. the AML folder) to confirm the link is correct.

fields.name: HouseholdLinkCorrect
fields.fieldText: Link correct?

fields.name: Header3
fields.fieldText: Portal Documents Setup | {!household.Name}

fields.name: GoogleUploadPrompt
fields.fieldText:
Double click the .zip file to unpack it. You'll see a folder with the same name appear that you can open up and where you'll find the contents of the Dropbox folder.


Open the Google Drive folder and confirm that it's:

  1. named CLIENT PORTAL DOCUMENTS
  2. empty of any contents

Ensure your screen is set up in a split mode as shown. Drag the contents of the folder into the Google Drive folder.

fields.name: GoogleUploadPrompt2
fields.fieldText: You'll see an upload tracker appear. Do not close the tab or window until the upload is complete. This could take a while depending on how long the client has been with us and how much data there is.

fields.name: GoogleArchivePrompt
fields.fieldText:
In the meantime, let's archive the original Portal Documents folder.


First, rename it to have the OW number at the start, e.g. OW6723 - Portal Documents.

fields.name: GoogleArchivePrompt2
fields.fieldText:
Then move it using either method below to the archive location.

  1. Select then use top menu
  2. Right click then use dropdown menu

You are moving it to a folder within the client folder called #Migrated Portal Documents

fields.name: OriginalGoogleFolderArchived
fields.fieldText: Original Google Portal Documents folder archived

fields.name: DropboxContentsUploadedToGoogleDriveFolder
fields.fieldText: Contents uploaded to Google Drive

fields.name: Header2
fields.fieldText: Portal Documents Setup | {!household.Name}

fields.name: DropboxDownloadPrompt
fields.fieldText:
1. Open the client folder
  2. Select all the files
  3. Click Download

fields.name: DropboxDownloadPrompt2
fields.fieldText:
While you're waiting for the download to complete, continue with the next 2 steps to remove link sharing.


﻿Click the Share button.

fields.name: DropboxRemoveEditLinkPrompt
fields.fieldText: Click Settings.

fields.name: DropboxRemoveEditLinkPrompt2
fields.fieldText: Click Link for editing and if there is a link, Delete link.

fields.name: DropboxEditLinkDeleted
fields.fieldText: Edit link deleted or never there

fields.name: ViewLinkPrompt
fields.fieldText: Select yes if no link applied.

fields.name: DropboxViewLinkDeleted
fields.fieldText: View link deleted or never there

fields.name: ArchiveFolderPrompt
fields.fieldText: Move the client folder into #Migrated Client Folders as shown below, navigating to the correct folder then clicking Move.

fields.name: DropboxClientFolderMovedToMigratedFolder
fields.fieldText: Dropbox folder archived

fields.name: PasswordSpreadsheetPrompt
fields.fieldText:
1. Go to the client passwords spreadsheet
  2. For this household, mark column J, migrated to portal documents, as Migrated

fields.name: DropboxPasswordSpreadsheetUpdated
fields.fieldText: Password spreadsheet updated

fields.name: DropboxWaitPrompt
fields.fieldText: Wait for the Dropbox download to complete. When complete, you'll see a .zip file like this.

fields.name: DropboxContentsDownloaded
fields.fieldText: Dropbox contents downloaded

fields.name: Header11
fields.fieldText: New Advice Folder Upload | {!household.Name}

fields.name: Portal_document_migration_4_eye_instructions_message
fields.fieldText:
Open the household folder and client visible documents folder to ensure the migration has been done correctly.


  1. Client household folder
  2. Client visible documents folder

fields.name: PortalDocsMigration4EyeComplete
fields.fieldText: Contents migrated correctly or issues resolved

fields.name: Header8
fields.fieldText: New Advice Folder Upload | {!household.Name}

fields.name: AdviceUploadSendEmailPromptAdvice
fields.fieldText: Now that the folder is ready with the migrated documents and new advice documents, we need to let the client know. Please email them using the {!TEMPLATE_NAME_PORTAL_DOCUMENTS_MIGRATED_ADVICE} template.

fields.name: AdviceUploadSendEmailPromptAdHoc
fields.fieldText: Now that the folder is ready with the migrated documents, we need to let the client know. Please email them using the {!TEMPLATE_NAME_PORTAL_DOCUMENTS_MIGRATED_AD_HOC} template.

fields.name: AdviceUploadSendEmailPromptActiveAlready
fields.fieldText: Now that the client's folder has the latest advice documents in it, please email them using the {!TEMPLATE_NAME_PORTAL_DOCUMENTS_ACTIVE} template.

fields.name: AdviceUploadSendEmailPromptHidden
fields.fieldText: Now that the client's folder has been set up and their 1st advice documents are in it, please email them using the {!TEMPLATE_NAME_PORTAL_DOCUMENTS_HIDDEN} template.

fields.name: AdviceUploadSendEmailPromptHiddenPreAdvice
fields.fieldText:
Now that the client's folder has been set up, please email them to let them know.


As this is an ad-hoc migration ahead of advice, there is no template defined here. This is likely to be for pre-retirement advice so consider using the template appropriate here.

fields.name: EmailPostMigration
fields.fieldText: I have emailed the client

fields.name: DateTimeEmailed
fields.fieldText: When did you email the client?

validationRule.errorMessage: Cannot be in the future

textTemplates.description: Instructions on how to set up a new advice folder.
textTemplates.name: AdviceFolderInstructions
textTemplates.text:
1. Create a folder for this advice in the household folder - we'll move it into the folder where the client can see it later*
    1. Name the folder {YYYY}.{MM}.{DD} - Your meeting
  2. Slides
    1. Make any updates that are needed to the advice slides like updating dates on the cover slide
    2. Save the slides as a PDF
    3. Place these in the new advice folder you created
  3. Add any other files to the advice folder like KIIDs, advice meeting recordings etc**
  4. When the folder is ready, move this into the {!GOOGLE_FOLDER_NAME} folder.


*The reason we do this is so that the folder and its contents are only visible when it's ready and not while you're working on it

** Note that only PDFs and MP4s are supported. If you have a requirement for something else, please raise this with the product team.

textTemplates.description: Instructions on how to set up the retirement call folder.
textTemplates.name: AdviceFolderInstructionsRetirementCall
textTemplates.text:
1. Create a folder for this advice in the household folder - we'll move it into the folder where the client can see it later*
    1. Name the folder {!retirementCallDateFolderFormat} - Your meeting
  2. Slides
    1. Make any updates that are needed to the advice slides like updating dates on the cover slide
    2. Save the slides as a PDF
    3. Place these in the new folder you created
  3. Recording
    1. Name the recording file appropriately
    2. Place in the new folder you created
  4. When the folder is ready, move this into the {!GOOGLE_FOLDER_NAME} folder.

*The reason we do this is so that the folder and its contents are only visible when it's ready and not while you're working on it

** Note that only PDFs and MP4s are supported. If you have a requirement for something else, please raise this with the product team.

variables.description: If true, this household is being migrated outside of the sharing of documents as part of our normal process.
variables.name: adHocMigration
